primary_trope.name: david_vs_goliath
primary_trope.hook_text: This Solid race beats half the Elite tier.
primary_trope.mechanism: Loss aversion — framing around what elite races LACK that this underdog HAS.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Devils Cardigan? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Devils Cardigan scored 54 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Devils Cardigan. Tasmania, Australia. 120 mi. Tasmanian mountain gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Length. 4 out of 5. Double-digit hours are on the table. The 106km course with 2,300m of climbing delivers serious distance that breaks riders down systematically. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Serious elevation. Train your climbing legs. Three major climbs define the suffering: 8. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. Experience. 4 out of 5. Genuinely unique. Hard to replicate. Justin Morris was "unrecognisable at the finish line but his grin from ear to ear was plain to see. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. The gravel "isn't what riders would normally call 'champagne gravel'" but rather "more like a rocky mountain bike trail in most parts. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Solid production value. The 2024 race delivered "a record breaking super fast race" with elite fields starting separately and systematic race development. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. Winners receive "a sack of potatoes and handmade wooly cardigan winners trophy" plus post-race craft beer and local pub dinner included.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Not enough altitude to blame for your pace. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Logistics. 1 out of 5. You are the aid station. Expenses. 1 out of 5. Budget-friendly. Your bank account barely notices.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Tasmanian Mountain Adventure. If you have a big budget and want a Tasmania experience. maybe. For most riders. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.narration: If Devils Cardigan isn't quite right for you. For better value: regional gravel races. For similar Australian terrain: Gravelista.
